intro: Adesmia microcalyx, commonly known as the small-flowered adesmia, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale pink. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, pod-like fruits. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and conservation efforts.
